p: The viruses of the family Coronaviridae contain enveloped and positive-stranded RNA (Li et al. 2020; Coutard et al. 2020). Coronaviruses have the largest 26–32 kilobase (kb) positive-sense RNA genome (Li et al. 2020; Kumar et al. 2020; Shoeman and Fielding 2019). The four major structural proteins [membrane (M), envelope (E), spike (S), and nucleocapsid (N)] which create complete virus particle, encoded by the genome (Kumar et al. 2020; Wu et al. 2020; Guo et al. 2020).
